task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 184°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building façade including the roofline to estimate height, so I should tilt upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointed north and up, so I need to rotate back to the south-facing building while keeping an upward pitch to see its top for height estimation.
I need the roofline and full vertical span of the south-facing building, so I should tilt up to include the top while staying oriented at 180°.
The camera keeps snapping to north after pitching, so I should explicitly rotate back to 184° south to face the target building.
Now correctly facing the south building, I should tilt up to capture the roofline for a height estimate.
Pitching up is again leaving me facing north, so I should rotate back to south (about 184°) while keeping the current upward pitch.
Since tilting up seems to reset the heading, I should keep pitch at 0° and instead move closer to better gauge floors/scale for height estimation.
I moved but I'm now facing west, so I need to rotate left to face the target building to the south (~184°) before estimating its height.
Rotation did not change my heading, so I should use the provided 'look left' to explicitly set heading to 180° (south) toward the building.
I need to directly face south, so I will rotate to set heading to 180°.
Yaw deltas are not changing the heading, so I should use an absolute rotation to heading 180° to face the building.
Since relative rotations aren't updating the heading, I'll directly set the yaw to face left (south) by rotating -90° again.
To face the building to the south, I should rotate to an absolute heading of 180° instead of applying another ineffective relative yaw.
The interface shows a direct left-look to heading 180°, so I'll rotate by -90° to align south toward the building.
I should use the explicit left-look heading value (180°) by rotating -90° from 270° to face the building south.
Rotations aren't changing the heading, so I'll change position by moving forward to get a different viewpoint and then reattempt alignment to the south-facing building.
Now I can use the provided left-look target heading (about 188°) to face the building to the south for height estimation.
Since yaw deltas aren't affecting heading, I should use a custom absolute rotation by setting yaw_delta to -90° is failing; instead I'll rotate by +180° to force a change and reorient.
Now that I'm correctly facing south toward the building, I can provide a height estimate based on a typical 2–3 story institutional building with a low roofline.
